ngiemboon: Ésàg tóŋo Yakwɔ̂b, ńgwaa néŋ mbʉ́lè na yé, ńne ńgɔɔn ngie: «Te zɔ́ʼɔ múɔ manzwě gẅie à kẅɛɛ láʼa Kánàhan.
en: So Isaac summoned Jacob, blessed him, and commanded him, “Do not marry a Canaanite girl.

ngiemboon: Lu ssé ńgʉa kwòŋo Alam á mbʉ̀a Mbetuwɛ tá pà má gù. Ɔ̀ ge kúu wó, é gʉa na púɔ panzwě pie é penkʉ́ Lambaŋ gẅie aa fɛ̌ má gù, é zɔ́ʼɔ tàʼ.
en: Go at once to Paddan-aram, to the house of Bethuel, your mother’s father. Marry one of the daughters of Laban, your mother’s brother.

ngiemboon: Á zɛ́te ngie e Ssé gie e pǔ ńgẅiin ngʉ̀ʼ, e cÿɔʼɔ gú; ńgÿo ɔ̀ zyé, ngẅɛ̀ jù zyéen, ɔ̀ láʼ ńcʉ́ʼʉ mángʉanjʉʼ meláʼ tà ńgyɔ́ɔn.
en: May God Almighty bless you and make you fruitful and multiply you   so that you become an assembly of peoples.  # 28:3 Gn 48:4

ngiemboon: Á zɛ́te ngie à néŋ mbʉ́lè gie à la néŋe na Ábalaham á na gù, mbɔɔ na ngẅɛ̀ jù, tá à cʉa púʼu, ɔ̀ jÿó láʼ gie ɔɔ wó, ńgwɔ́ kÿoláʼ. Á láʼ gie e Ssé la ná né Ábalaham!»
en: May God give you and your offspring the blessing of Abraham   so that you may possess the land where you live as a foreigner, the land God gave to Abraham.”  # 28:4 Gn 12:7; 15:18

ngiemboon: Ésàg tsẅi, Yakwɔ̂b gʉa né kwòŋo Alam, á mbʉ̀a Lambaŋ gẅie aa fɛ̌ Lɛpékà má pa Yakwɔ̂b pɔ́ Ezagẅi; Lambaŋ ŋwɛ́, á gwɔ́ míŋ Mbetuwɛ nyìŋ Alam.
en: So Isaac sent Jacob to Paddan-aram, to Laban son of Bethuel the Aramean, the brother of Rebekah, the mother of Jacob and Esau.

ngiemboon: Ezagẅi júʼ ngie, Ésàg néŋ mbʉ́lè na Yakwɔ̂b tà ńtúmo yé kwòŋo Alam ngie à gʉa wó, éfaʼa nzwě we. Ńgíŋe ńjúʼ ngie Ésàg gwáa néŋ mbʉ́lè na Yakwɔ̂b, ńtÿɔ́gɔ yé ngie à pɔ́ɔn léláʼ ńzɔ́ʼɔ múɔ Kánàhan.
en: Esau noticed that Isaac blessed Jacob and sent him to Paddan-aram to get a wife there. When he blessed him, Isaac commanded Jacob, “Do not marry a Canaanite girl.”

ngiemboon: Ezagẅi gwaa júʼ púʼu, mbà Yakwɔ̂b jǔʼ ncwò tá we pɔ́ má we, tà ńgʉa né kwòŋo Alam.
en: And Jacob listened to his father and mother and went to Paddan-aram.

ngiemboon: Ezagẅi zsé ngie tá we te púɔ Kánàhan kwoŋ.
en: Esau realized that his father Isaac disapproved of the Canaanite women,

ngiemboon: Ńgʉa mbʉ̀a Esemayɛ̂ɛ míŋ Ábalaham, éfaʼa Mahalad ńzɔ́ʼɔ yé, ńkẅiʼi na mezwě pé. Mahalad laa púʼu ńgwɔ́ míŋ Esemayɛ̂ɛ, wemanzwě, à la ńgẅiin tsɔ̌ fɛ̌ we lezíŋ sé gwɔ́ lê Nembayɔd.
en: so Esau went to Ishmael and married, in addition to his other wives, Mahalath daughter of Ishmael, Abraham’s son. She was the sister of Nebaioth.

ngiemboon: Yakwɔ̂b fó Mbɛɛshÿeba ńgʉa né Alaŋ.
en: Jacob left Beer-sheba and went toward Haran.

ngiemboon: Ńgʉa tà ńkúu tsɔ́ jʉʼ, nzěm síŋ, á láʼa jʉʼó. À la gwaa nuŋe, ḿbíi tsɔ̌ tàʼ na metǒon pie é laa jʉʼó, ńdɔg ńtóonte twó yé, tá ńdyé.
en: He reached a certain place and spent the night there because the sun had set. He took one of the stones from the place, put it there at his head, and lay down in that place.

ngiemboon: Ńne ńdyé púʼu, ńdyé njÿòon, ńgyá kwɔ́ʼ, éfó ssé, ńkwɔ́ʼ kwɔ́ʼ tà ńkíbe lefaŋ. Mecÿɔ́ʼ Ssé ne fóo mǒ, ńkwɔ́ʼɔ ḿbiŋe ésẅɛ́ʼɛ.
en: And he dreamed:   A stairway was set on the ground with its top reaching the sky, and God’s angels were going up and down on it.  # 28:12 Jn 1:51

ngiemboon: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a tyé ndumó, ńgɔɔn ngie: «Mèŋ n gee Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, é Ssé Ábalaham gẅie aa tá gù, ńgwɔ́ Ssé Ésàg. Atsetsáʼ gie ɔ̀ nuŋe mǒ lɛ̂, n ge gÿo náa mbwó gù tà mbɔɔ mbwó ngẅɛ̀ jù.
en: The Lord was standing there beside him,   saying, “I am the Lord,  # 28:13 Gn 15:7; Ex 6:8 the God of your father Abraham and the God of Isaac. I will give you and your offspring the land on which you are lying.

ngiemboon: Engẅɛ̀ jù ge gÿo gyɔ́ɔn páʼ mvɔbɔ́ pfepfɔ́b. Ɔ̀ ge gÿo jÿó shÿó mbyěnèm, é jÿó shÿó sǎʼnèm, é jÿó shÿó twó kwóŋ, é piŋ jÿó shÿó ntsíŋ. N ge gÿo cʉate pɔ́ na gù, mbɔɔ na ngẅɛ̀ jù, tá néŋ mbʉ́lè na menkenkÿo tsìŋendá ndùmo ssé tsetsáʼ.
en: Your offspring will be like the dust of the earth,   and you will spread out toward the west, the east, the north, and the south. All the peoples on earth will be blessed through you and your offspring.  # 28:14 Gn 12:3

ngiemboon: N gee né gù, n ge pyɛ́bɛ gú, á jʉʼ ntsèm gie ɔ̀ ge gʉa wó. É piŋ lɔgɔ gú piŋ né wɔɔn ngwòŋ, ngwɔ́ ń de gú gwáʼ; tà láʼ kú fʉ̀ʼ gie n gÿǒ mmó gie n da shwóŋo gú.»
en: Look, I am with you and will watch over you wherever you go. I will bring you back to this land,   for I will not leave you until I have done what I have promised you.”

ngiemboon: Yakwɔ̂b zyeen ńgɔɔn ngie: «Áa kwaʼ nénʉ́, Cʉ̀apʉ̀a aa jʉʼɔɔn. Táʼ, n ka te ne ńzsé wɔ́.»
en: When Jacob awoke from his sleep, he said, “Surely the Lord is in this place, and I did not know it.”

ngiemboon: Ecÿɔʼ gwoon yé, á gɔɔn ngie: «Yɔɔn áa jʉʼ té mémá we, yɔɔn ée ndá Ssé. Ńgwɔ́ ncwò tÿǒ lepwó!»
en: He was afraid and said, “What an awesome place this is! This is none other than the house of God. This is the gate of heaven.”

ngiemboon: Yakwɔ̂b gÿo ńdu ssé tsɛ̀ɛ mbaʼámbaʼ, ńkáa tóon gẅie à ka lɔg ńtóonte twó yé, ḿbʉʼʉ ńtÿɔ́g tÿɔ́g, ḿpfɛte mevɛ́ ndumó.
en: Early in the morning Jacob took the stone that was near his head and set it up as a marker. He poured oil on top of it

ngiemboon: Ńtsẅi lezíŋ jʉʼó lê Mbetɛɛ «ńdɔgɔ ńgɔɔn ngie ndá Ssé.» Mbà mé kɔ́ɔn ńzɔɔn ńtóŋo yɛ̌ tÿǒsoŋ lê Lûuzè.
en: and named the place Bethel,   though previously the city was named Luz.  # 28:19 Gn 35:6; 48:3; Jdg 1:23,26

ngiemboon: Yakwɔ̂b záb ngie: «Cʉ̀apʉ̀a lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ né mèŋ, ḿbyɛ́bɛ wɔ́ɔn mánzsè jʉʼ gie n gee né wó, ńnáa wɔ́ɔn mbelég gie n ge pfɛ́, ńnáa wɔ́ɔn nzsǒ gie n ge maʼ,
en: Then Jacob made a vow:   “If God will be with me and watch over me during this journey I’m making, if he provides me with food to eat and clothing to wear,

ngiemboon: m biŋ ḿbiŋ né lesaʼá peg té lɔ̌ʼ, mbà Cʉ̀apʉ̀a ge gwɔ́ Ssé yɔ̀ɔn.
en: and if I return safely to my father’s family,   then the Lord will be my God.  # 28:21 Dt 26:17

ngiemboon: Tóon wɔɔn gẅie m bʉʼʉ́ ńtÿɔ́g tÿɔ́g lɔɔn ge láʼ cʉ́ʼ ndá Ssé. N ge láʼa gee na shúm sɔ́ɔn nzsè legém, é píi tàʼ nzsè, é náa mbwó Ssé.»
en: This stone that I have set up as a marker will be God’s house, and I will give to you a tenth of all that you give me.”
